item.title: Infinity Nikki: All Revelry Season Outfits
item.description:
The Revelry Season in Infinity Nikki features some of the most vibrant and exciting fashion yet, to help commemorate the Faewish Sprites' annual Wishing Dance Party. There are several new outfits for players to unlock in a variety of ways, from new Resonance banners to special challenges and new store additions.

It can be tricky to keep track of every single new outfit in Infinity Nikki's new Revelry Season, so here's a guide that provides a comprehensive list of each one and how to unlock them for your wardrobe.

All Outfits in Revelry Season of Infinity Nikki (How to Unlock)

So far in the Revelry Season (1.4) of Infinity Nikki , there are a total of 20 new outfits that you can obtain for your collection. This includes all evolution variants of certain outfits as well as new looks for Momo. A mid-season update in April will add even more outfits, so be sure to check this list for new information once that update releases.

All of these outfits are currently available until the end of the Revelry Season on April 28, 2025 , so make sure to claim the ones you want most for your wardrobe as soon as you can. Of course, as always, budget accordingly for the ones that cost money rather than in-game currency.

item.title: One Minor Feature From Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Could Be A Major Pokemon Legends: Z-A Mechanic
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A may feature traversal mechanics seen in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet and Sword and Shield.
  • Rotom phone could replace Ride Pokemon in Legends: Z-A for in-game navigation.
  • Legends: Z-A setting a precedent for future games by utilizing the Rotom phone for traversal.

While a potentially major mechanic may have been revealed during Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's latest trailer, it might not be entirely new as it may have already featured first in Gen 9's Pokemon Scarlet and Violet before the upcoming game. Though it was far from the focus of Game Freak's long-overdue update for Legends: Z-A , the game's recent trailer may have teased a new approach to traversal mechanics with the return of the Rotom phone. Besides the possibility of foregoing Ride Pokemon as seen in Pokemon Legends: Arceus , Legends: Z-A could be adopting mechanics previously seen in Scarlet and Violet and even Sword and Shield .

Following Game Freak's decision to transition Pokemon games to an open-world design, each subsequent game in the mainline series has experimented with different approaches to in-game traversal. Yet, despite the recent use of Ride Pokemon in both Legends: Arceus, and Scarlet and Violet , it seems that Pokemon Legends: Z-A is falling back on the Rotom phone for its traversal mechanics, just as it had in Sword and Shield . The potential evidence for this lies in a blink-and-you'll-miss-it moment from Legends: Z-A 's trailer that features an uncannily similar animation to something more recently seen in Scarlet and Violet .

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Could Be Expanding on Pokemon Scarlet and Violet's Rotom Phone

Since Pokemon Sun and Moon first reworked Rotom to serve more practical purposes like a Pokedex, Game Freak has pushed the envelope for what this formerly unique Gen 4 Pokemon can do in recent games. With the Rotom phone becoming a new Pokemon series staple between Sword and Shield and Scarlet and Violet , it seems Legends: Z-A will take a similar approach after it appeared in its latest trailer. However, approximately halfway through that same trailer, the player character can be seen jumping between buildings using an animation that seems eerily familiar to how Scarlet and Violet ​​​​​​prevented its players from taking fall damage.

While Legends: Arceus wasn't as forgiving as Scarlet and Violet , the previous Gen 9 games had included this small, seemingly minor feature where players would hold onto their Rotom phones right before falling to the ground from a high enough height. This animation appears nearly identical to the sequence seen in Legends: Z-A 's trailer as the player character holds something close to their torso and is carried in a "floating" arc between the buildings. Though there has been no official confirmation that this is the case, it seems likely that Legends: Z-A could be expanding on this small Scarlet and Violet feature in a big way.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Might Be Avoiding Pokemon Legends: Arceus' Ride Pokemon

However, while it makes sense chronologically for Legends: Z-A to use the Rotom phone, given its modern-day setting, this would put the game at odds with its predecessor, Legends: Arceus . Though considered part of the mainline series, these games still appear to be outliers, with the expectation being that they share similarities, such as both Pokemon Legends games sharing an intergenerational starter trio or each one featuring a single Legendary mascot Pokemon. With no Ride Pokemon shown during Legends: Z-A 's recent trailer, the game could replace these with the Rotom phone as it distances itself from Legends: Arceus ' Ride Pokemon.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Might Even Be Falling Back To Pokemon Sword and Shield's Rotom Phone

Yet this wouldn't be the first time Game Freak has used the Rotom phone for in-game navigation, as Sword and Shield debuted the Rotom bike to traverse its open world, something which Legends: Z-A could be falling back on. With Koraidon and Miraidon playing key roles in Scarlet and Violet 's story, it's possible that Game Freak needed a modern-day alternative for Legends: Z-A and wanted to avoid Legends: Arceus ' multiple Ride Pokemon. As a result, Legends: Z-A could set a precedent for future Pokemon games, with the Rotom phone, bike, and potentially more taking over as the series' in-game traversal mechanics.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows: Ancient Tomb Of Nanjo Location & Solution
item.description:
Raiding a Kofun is one of the most fun side activities that players can complete in Assassin's Creed Shadows . Each Kofun has a different mind-boggling design, and players are required to traverse through them to reach the legendary chest at the end. The Ancient Tomb of Nanjo is one of the first Kofun players will encounter in the Yamashiro region, which holds one of the best legendary tanto for Naoe.

Ancient Tomb of Nanjo Kofun Location in Assassin's Creed Shadows

Players can find the Ancient Tomb of Nanjo in the Eagle's Nest area of the Yamashiro region in Assassin's Creed Shadows . The tomb entrance is located just west of the Southern Kyoto Kakurega, across the river. After reaching the undiscovered location, the name of the kofun will pop up. Now, players can simply descend the Ancient Tomb of Nanjo and start exploring.

Ancient Tomb of Nanjo Solution

The Ancient Tomb of Nanjo is confusing to navigate as players can get turned around quite easily due to its branching pathways . Here's how you can complete this Kofun and get the legendary chest at the end.

  1. Descend the stairs of the Ancient Tomb of Nanjo Kofun and jump into the pond below.
  2. Keep moving through the narrow cave system until you arrive in a large room with a pond and two pathways on the left and right.
  3. Take the pathway to the right, and you'll need to drop into another room with branching pathways.
  4. Again, take the pathway to the right and keep moving ahead until you reach a pond with two stone pillars in the middle. Use the pillars to get across.
  5. Once you head across the pond and drop further into the cavern, you'll need to enter a crawlspace and reach the other side.
  6. Now, head up the staircase and keep heading forward until you arrive at a large pond. Jump into the pond and head left, climb the stone pillars, and you'll drop into a chamber with multiple pathways, again.
  7. Choose the path ahead, use the stone pillars to climb to the higher section, and squeeze through the crack to open a chest.
  8. Now, exit the chamber and use the grappling hook to get across the pond below.
  9. Climb up to the higher platform using indentations on the wall and follow the cave, only to arrive in a room with two pathways.
  10. Take the left pathway and keep following the caverns to finally arrive at the legendary chest.

Reward for Completing the Ancient Tomb of Nanjo in AC Shadows

After opening the legendary chest in the Ancient Tomb of Nanjo Kofun in AC Shadows , players will receive Yukimitsu's Revenge , a legendary tanto alongside its engraving that makes enemies who are afflicted with a status effect vulnerable. The weapon also comes with a high poison buildup, which synergizes well with its unique perk.

item.title: 8 Common Mistakes To Avoid In Euro Truck Simulator 2
item.description:
Summary

  • Players shouldn't rush to buy their favorite truck. Save money early and invest wisely to maximize earning potential.
  • Ignoring speed limits can be costly in Euro Truck Simulator 2 due to realistic consequences.
  • Rest when required to avoid fines and blackouts. Plan rest stops carefully for long hauls to avoid penalties.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is one of the most immersive and realistic driving simulators available, allowing players to not only experience life on the road as a truck driver but also manage their own transportation business. However, due to the game's depth and attention to detail, many players make simple mistakes that can negatively impact their experience and enjoyment.

From wasting money early on to overlooking key features that enhance immersion, these common mistakes can lead to frustration, delays, fines, and even discourage players from continuing the game. Here are some common mistakes that players will want to avoid in Euro Truck Simulator 2 .

8 Misunderstanding The Game

Euro Truck Simulator 2 Isn't A Racing Game

When picking up Euro Truck Simulator 2 , many players, especially those new to simulation games, mistakenly assume it plays like a typical arcade-style racing game. This misunderstanding often leads to new players putting down the game before they experience how rewarding it can be.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 isn’t just a driving simulator, it also features economic and business mechanics that let players build their own transportation company. Overlooking these aspects can make the game feel empty, so it's best for players to familiarize themselves with the key aspects of the game before giving up on it.

7 Rushing To Buy A Favorite Truck

Save Money At The Start To Earn More In The Long Run

Once players have earned a decent amount of money, they often rush to buy their favorite trucks. Although this isn't a massive mistake, it can be quite costly in the long run. Instead of spending all their funds on a dream truck, players should invest wisely to maximize their earning potential.

A better approach is to start with a decent beginner truck, then save enough to purchase a second truck and hire an employee. This additional driver can generate passive income, helping to grow the business while players continue driving. After a while, players will be able to afford their dream trucks while having enough money and passive income to upgrade their trucks and expand their company.

6 Ignoring Speed Limits

Speeding Comes At A Cost

As a detailed driving simulator, Euro Truck Simulator 2 naturally enforces speed limits. While they can be frustrating, they add to the game's realism and immersion. However, unlike in most real-world countries, the game provides few to no speed camera warning signs, often catching players off guard.

When running late, it's easy to overlook speed limits, especially without clear camera warnings. This can quickly become costly, especially if the player passes multiple cameras. For players who prefer a more relaxed experience, traffic offenses can be disabled in the game settings.

5 Skipping Rest Stops

Make Sure To Rest When Required

Much like in real life, drivers in Euro Truck Simulator 2 must rest. After about 11 in-game hours without sleep, the driver will become fatigued. If the rest is ignored, the screen will eventually go black, causing players to lose control of their truck. Failing to rest also results in fines, making it crucial to plan rest stops during long hauls.

In some countries, rest stops are few and far between, making it essential to plan rest breaks before setting off on long trips. Additionally, players must account for time lost while resting, as shorter jobs may not allocate extra time for breaks. Poor planning can lead to missed deadlines and late deliveries, resulting in penalties.

4 Ignoring Cargo Weight

Make Sure The Truck Can Handle The Weight

In Euro Truck Simulator 2 , any truck can be used for any job, regardless of the cargo weight. However, not all trucks can handle heavy loads efficiently. Weaker trucks may struggle, especially on uphill routes. Choosing a truck with sufficient power is crucial for smooth and timely deliveries.

Before accepting a heavy-load job in Euro Truck Simulator 2 , players should ensure their truck is capable of handling it, particularly when the route includes mountainous terrain. A common mistake is assuming that an expensive truck can manage heavy loads. In reality, it’s better to invest in a truck and specialize it for heavy cargo to ensure smooth and efficient deliveries.

3 Not Using Cruise Control

Give Your Feet A Break

One of the most underutilized features in Euro Truck Simulator 2 is Cruise Control. Cruise Control is most effective when traveling on a long stretch of road and can make the game a little smoother for players, especially those playing with a full steering wheel and pedal setup.

Depending on the system, players can map cruise control to any desired button and further customize it in the game’s settings, including options for increasing or decreasing speed. However, it’s important to note that cruise control will automatically turn off when changing gears or braking.

2 Ignoring Vehicle Maintenance

Keep Vehicles Well Maintained

Although vehicle maintenance can be costly early in Euro Truck Simulator 2 , players should never neglect it. Given the game's attention to detail, any damage to the player's truck will impact gameplay, and regular maintenance is essential for smooth operation.

Collisions with other drivers can lead to engine issues, gear problems, and other difficulties that make driving more challenging. Tire maintenance is particularly important, as tires wear down after most jobs, especially longer ones, and can significantly affect a truck’s performance if left for a long time.

1 Not Utilizing Key/Button Mapping

Make Gameplay More Immersive

Euro Truck Simulator 2 offers a wide range of customizable controls that players can assign to their keyboards, controllers, steering wheels, and other peripherals. Properly mapping these commands enhances gameplay, making it more intuitive, immersive, and enjoyable. Players can map useful controls like indicators and light control, as well as less-used controls like front and rear suspension.

These customization options are especially useful with a steering wheel, as they greatly enhance immersion. Mapping essential controls, such as ‘interior look left/right,’ to easily accessible keys/buttons makes first-person driving much smoother, particularly when parking or maneuvering in tight spaces. Players using limited-input devices, such as console controllers on PC, can optimize their setup by removing unnecessary bindings to free up space for more useful controls.
